message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms suggest an anaphylactic reaction. Epinephrine is the first-line treatment for anaphylaxis, followed by diphenhydramine for histamine-mediated symptoms such as the urticarial rash. Continuous monitoring is important but not the next best step in managing the acute symptoms. Albuterol may help with wheezing, but it is not the primary treatment for anaphylaxis.

Albuterol may help with wheezing but is not the immediate priority in this situation. Continuous monitoring and diphenhydramine may also be necessary, but epinephrine is the first-line treatment for anaphylaxis.

Epinephrine is the best first-line treatment for anaphylaxis. Continuous monitoring should also be done to ensure the patient’s stability. Albuterol may help with wheezing, but it is not the first-line treatment for anaphylaxis. Diphenhydramine can be used for symptom relief, but it should not be the first-line treatment for hypotension or respiratory distress.
